entry.tran: (疾病等)严重损害健康(或身体)的
entry.def: A crippling illness or  disability is one that severely damages your health or your body.

example.ex: Arthritis and rheumatism are prominent crippling diseases...
example.tran: 关节炎和风湿病是会严重损害身体健康的主要疾病。

example.ex: They both suffered from crippling pains in their hips.
example.tran: 他们俩都感到髋部疼痛难忍。

entry.def: If you say that an action, policy, or situation has a crippling effect on something, you mean it has a very serious, harmful effect.

example.ex: The high cost of capital has a crippling effect on many small American high-tech firms...
example.tran: 高昂的资金成本严重影响了美国的很多小型高科技公司。

example.ex: The American military presence on the islands had suffered a crippling blow.
example.tran: 该群岛上的美国部队受到了严重打击。

means.word_mean: 1. that cripples or disables or incapacitates;

means.word_mean: 极有害的;有严重后果的

sentences.en: He was burdened with crippling debts.
the crippling effect of sanctions on the economy
sentences.cn: 制裁对经济产生的毀灭性后果
